content: can end up with a bulge or hole in the second round or at least i do… so on these parts i ve instructed you to single_crochet in each single_crochet around including the slip_stitch from the previous round which may be confusing what i mean by this is to go ahead and crochet in the last stitch on the round the one that you made when you slip stitched to the first round this stitch is usually skipped you will have one extra stitch in that round but you are supposed to on these parts you could just put 2 single_crochet in the last single_crochet increase in the last single_crochet if that works better for you or makes more sense 4 on the main part of the body starting in row 7 you re going to be changing colors mid-row and using up to 3 colors in one row i recommend you carry all colors of yarn around each row holding only the color you are currently using in your left hand and catching the color s you are not using inside the piece with the color you are currently using row 16 26 are the row with 3 colors if you are not catching the unused colors with the current color it s going to make it hard to stuff the polyfil into the body later on page 3 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com the pattern a = black b = brown w = white the head and body row instructions stitches 1 start using a black 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around including the slip_stitch from the previous round 7 3 cut a and start using w white 8 single_crochet in 6 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in last stitch 4 single_crochet in each single_crochet 2 single_crochet in last single_crochet increase 9 5 work even 9 6 *single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 12 7 w 1 increase in same as joining 5 single_crochet b 1 increase w 5 single_crochet 1 increase in last 15 8 w single_crochet in first 6 single_crochet b increase in next 2 single_crochet w 1 increase single_crochet in last 6 single_crochet 18 9- work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 18 11 w 2 single_crochet b 14 single_crochet w 2 single_crochet 12 w increase in first 3 single_crochet b 12 single_crochet w increase in last 3 single_crochet 24 13 you won t need brown for 3 row you can cut it off or let it hang there 21 w single_crochet in first 9 single_crochet *decrease* 3 times single_crochet in last 9 single_crochet **place safety eyes now if you re using them in between row 7 & 8 near the brown forehead as shown in the pictures then stuff the nose since you won t be able to get to it later on ** 14 w 2 single_crochet in first single_crochet same as joining single_crochet
